sect1.title: Fractal Analysis
sect1.para: In practice objects exhibiting random properties are encountered. It is often assumed that these objects exhibit the self-affine properties in a certain range of scales. Self-affinity is a generalization of self-similarity which is the basic property of most of the deterministic fractals. A part of self-affine object is similar to whole object after anisotropic scaling. Many randomly rough surfaces are assumed to belong to the random objects that exhibit the self-affine properties and they are treated self-affine statistical fractals. Of course, these surfaces can be studied using atomic force microscopy (AFM). The results of the fractal analysis of the self-affine random surfaces using AFM are often used to classify these surfaces prepared by various technological procedures [1,2,3,4].

The variance method [3,4] is based on the scale dependence of the variance of fractional Brownian motion. In practice, in the variance method one divides the full surface into equal-sized squared boxes, and the variance (power of RMS value of heights), is calculated for particular box size. Fractal dimension is evaluated from the slope
β \beta
of a least-square regression line fit to the data points in log-log plot of variance as
Df = 3 − β/2 D_{\rm f} = 3-\beta/2 .

Power spectrum method [3, 4, 5] is based on the power spectrum dependence of fractional Brownian motion. sect1.para: The axes in Fractal Dimension graphs always show already logarithmed quantities, therefore the linear dependences mentioned above corresponds to straight lines there. The measure of the axes should be treated as arbitrary.
Note, that results of different methods differ. This fact is caused by systematic error of different fractal analysis approaches.

Moreover, the results of the fractal analysis can be influenced strongly by the tip convolution. We recommned therefore to check the certainty map before fractal analysis. In cases when the surface is influenced a lot by tip imaging, the results of the fractal analysis can be misrepresented strongly.
Note, that algorithms that can be used within the fractal analysis module are also used in Fractal Correction module and Fractal Correction option of Remove Spots tool.
